attributes.doc: Protocol/stimulus name for this patch-clamp dataset.
attributes.name: stimulus_description

attributes.doc: Sweep number, allows to group different PatchClampSeries together.
attributes.name: sweep_number

attributes.doc: Base unit of measurement for working with the data. Actual stored values are not necessarily stored in these units. To access the data in these units, multiply 'data' by 'conversion' and add 'offset'.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.doc: Recorded voltage or current.
datasets.name: data

datasets.doc: Gain of the recording, in units Volt/Amp (v-clamp) or Volt/Volt (c-clamp).
datasets.name: gain

groups.doc: An abstract base class for patch-clamp data - stimulus or response, current or voltage.

links.doc: Link to IntracellularElectrode object that describes the electrode that was used to apply or record this data.
links.name: electrode

attributes.doc: Base unit of measurement for working with the data. which is fixed to 'volts'. Actual stored values are not necessarily stored in these units. To access the data in these units, multiply 'data' by 'conversion' and add 'offset'.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.doc: Recorded voltage.
datasets.name: data

datasets.doc: Bias current, in amps.
datasets.name: bias_current

datasets.doc: Bridge balance, in ohms.
datasets.name: bridge_balance

datasets.doc: Capacitance compensation, in farads.
datasets.name: capacitance_compensation

groups.doc: Voltage data from an intracellular current-clamp recording. A corresponding CurrentClampStimulusSeries (stored separately as a stimulus) is used to store the current injected.

attributes.doc: An IZeroClampSeries has no stimulus, so this attribute is automatically set to "N/A"
attributes.name: stimulus_description

datasets.doc: Bias current, in amps, fixed to 0.0.
datasets.name: bias_current

datasets.doc: Bridge balance, in ohms, fixed to 0.0.
datasets.name: bridge_balance

datasets.doc: Capacitance compensation, in farads, fixed to 0.0.
datasets.name: capacitance_compensation

groups.doc: Voltage data from an intracellular recording when all current and amplifier settings are off (i.e., CurrentClampSeries fields will be zero). There is no CurrentClampStimulusSeries associated with an IZero series because the amplifier is disconnected and no stimulus can reach the cell.

attributes.doc: Base unit of measurement for working with the data. which is fixed to 'amperes'. Actual stored values are not necessarily stored in these units. To access the data in these units, multiply 'data' by 'conversion' and add 'offset'.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.doc: Stimulus current applied.
datasets.name: data

groups.doc: Stimulus current applied during current clamp recording.

attributes.doc: Base unit of measurement for working with the data. which is fixed to 'amperes'. Actual stored values are not necessarily stored in these units. To access the data in these units, multiply 'data' by 'conversion' and add 'offset'.

datasets.name: data

attributes.doc: Unit of measurement for resistance_comp_bandwidth, which is fixed to 'hertz'.

attributes.doc: Unit of measurement for resistance_comp_correction, which is fixed to 'percent'.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.name: resistance_comp_correction

attributes.doc: Unit of measurement for resistance_comp_prediction, which is fixed to 'percent'.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.doc: Resistance compensation prediction, in percent.
datasets.name: resistance_comp_prediction

attributes.doc: Unit of measurement for whole_cell_capacitance_comp, which is fixed to 'farads'.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.name: whole_cell_capacitance_comp

attributes.doc: Unit of measurement for whole_cell_series_resistance_comp, which is fixed to 'ohms'.

datasets.doc: Whole cell series resistance compensation, in ohms.
datasets.name: whole_cell_series_resistance_comp

groups.doc: Current data from an intracellular voltage-clamp recording. A corresponding VoltageClampStimulusSeries (stored separately as a stimulus) is used to store the voltage injected.

attributes.doc: Base unit of measurement for working with the data. which is fixed to 'volts'. Actual stored values are not necessarily stored in these units. To access the data in these units, multiply 'data' by 'conversion' and add 'offset'.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.doc: Stimulus voltage applied.
datasets.name: data

groups.doc: Stimulus voltage applied during a voltage clamp recording.

datasets.doc: unique ID of the cell
datasets.name: cell_id

datasets.name: description

datasets.doc: Electrode specific filtering.
datasets.name: filtering

datasets.doc: Initial access resistance.
datasets.name: initial_access_resistance

datasets.doc: Location of the electrode. Specify the area, layer, comments on estimation of area/layer, stereotaxic coordinates if in vivo, etc. Use standard atlas names for anatomical regions when possible.
datasets.name: location

datasets.doc: Electrode resistance, in ohms.
datasets.name: resistance

datasets.name: seal

groups.doc: [DEPRECATED] Table used to group different PatchClampSeries. SweepTable is being replaced by IntracellularRecordingsTable and SimultaneousRecordingsTable tables. Additional SequentialRecordingsTable, RepetitionsTable, and ExperimentalConditions tables provide enhanced support for experiment metadata.

attributes.doc: Description of the contents of this table. Inherited from AlignedDynamicTable and overwritten here to fix the value of the attribute.
attributes.name: description
attributes.value: A table to group together a stimulus and response from a single electrode and a single simultaneous recording and for storing metadata about the intracellular recording.

groups.doc: A table to group together a stimulus and response from a single electrode and a single simultaneous recording. Each row in the table represents a single recording consisting typically of a stimulus and a corresponding response. In some cases, however, only a stimulus or a response is recorded as part of an experiment. In this case, both the stimulus and response will point to the same TimeSeries while the idx_start and count of the invalid column will be set to -1, thus, indicating that no values have been recorded for the stimulus or response, respectively. Note, a recording MUST contain at least a stimulus or a response. Typically the stimulus and response are PatchClampSeries. However, the use of AD/DA channels that are not associated to an electrode is also common in intracellular electrophysiology, in which case other TimeSeries may be used.
Table for storing intracellular electrode related metadata.
groups.name: electrodes

groups.doc: Table for storing intracellular stimulus related metadata.
groups.name: stimuli

groups.doc: Table for storing intracellular response related metadata.
groups.name: responses
intracellular_recordings

attributes.doc: Reference to the IntracellularRecordingsTable table that this table region applies to. This specializes the attribute inherited from DynamicTableRegion to fix the type of table that can be referenced here.
attributes.name: table

datasets.doc: A reference to one or more rows in the IntracellularRecordingsTable table.
datasets.name: recordings

datasets.doc: Index dataset for the recordings column.
datasets.name: recordings_index

groups.doc: A table for grouping different intracellular recordings from the IntracellularRecordingsTable table together that were recorded simultaneously from different electrodes.
groups.name: simultaneous_recordings

attributes.doc: Reference to the SimultaneousRecordingsTable table that this table region applies to. This specializes the attribute inherited from DynamicTableRegion to fix the type of table that can be referenced here.
attributes.name: table

datasets.doc: A reference to one or more rows in the SimultaneousRecordingsTable table.
datasets.name: simultaneous_recordings

datasets.doc: Index dataset for the simultaneous_recordings column.
datasets.name: simultaneous_recordings_index

datasets.doc: The type of stimulus used for the sequential recording.
datasets.name: stimulus_type

groups.doc: A table for grouping different sequential recordings from the SimultaneousRecordingsTable table together. This is typically used to group together sequential recordings where a sequence of stimuli of the same type with varying parameters have been presented in a sequence.
groups.name: sequential_recordings

attributes.doc: Reference to the SequentialRecordingsTable table that this table region applies to. This specializes the attribute inherited from DynamicTableRegion to fix the type of table that can be referenced here.
attributes.name: table

datasets.doc: A reference to one or more rows in the SequentialRecordingsTable table.
datasets.name: sequential_recordings

datasets.doc: Index dataset for the sequential_recordings column.
datasets.name: sequential_recordings_index

groups.doc: A table for grouping different sequential intracellular recordings together. With each SequentialRecording typically representing a particular type of stimulus, the RepetitionsTable table is typically used to group sets of stimuli applied in sequence.
groups.name: repetitions

attributes.doc: Reference to the RepetitionsTable table that this table region applies to. This specializes the attribute inherited from DynamicTableRegion to fix the type of table that can be referenced here.
attributes.name: table

datasets.doc: A reference to one or more rows in the RepetitionsTable table.
datasets.name: repetitions

datasets.doc: Index dataset for the repetitions column.
datasets.name: repetitions_index

groups.doc: A table for grouping different intracellular recording repetitions together that belong to the same experimental condition.
groups.name: experimental_conditions
